thread.title: Landrieu administration reaches agreement with fire fighters
thread.title_full: Landrieu administration reaches agreement with fire fighters - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social

author: Written by: FOX8Live.com Staff
title: Landrieu administration reaches agreement with fire fighters
text:
NEW ORLEANS, LA (WVUE) - The administration of Mayor Mitch Landrieu reportedly has reached a deal with New Orleans fire fighters in a decades-old fight over back pay and other compensation.
The agreement involves a nearly $100 million legal settlement. The city's financial obligation to the fire fighters has fueled contentious debate between the fire fighters’ union and the mayor, who at one point faced house arrest for refusing a judge’s order to pay up.
Late Thursday evening, the mayor’s director of communications sent the following statement:
“The settlement with the firefighters keeps the city on a positive fiscal track, gets major reforms to the pension, and ensures that the pension fund will be there for firefighters in the future. Tomorrow, Mayor Landrieu, alongside other officials, will announce the details of the settlement.“
Copyright 2015 WVUE.
